full_text:
Business Rules — Activities

Lesson
objectives

¢ Explain the role of business activity rules in
ClaimCenter

« Write business activity rules to create
activities, set fields, and add history records

| Activities review G
¢ An activity is a task or unit of work involved in handling a claim (a to do list)
¢ In ClaimCenter, activities are used to track the completion of tasks

¢ Activities are created and assigned to groups and users to complete

Activities
Allopen 7
vy Due + Priority > Subject Claim >
5) 04/10/2018 High Review coverage in question 235-53-425888
5) 04/10/2018 High Review coverage in question 235-53-425891
y 08/06/2018 High Follow up with vendor - work not accepted in 225-52-365889
timely manner

08/11/2018 High Send reservation of rights letter 235-53-365870

| Business activity rules G
¢ Business activity rules are used to automatically create activities
¢ Business activity rule definitions control when and what activities are created

¢ Creating the rules requires only limited knowledge of the Guidewire data model

| Business activity rules

* Can automatically create activities and history records
* Can also change the value of fields on an object (claim or exposure)
¢ Enable quick response to changing business needs without coding
« Are managed in the ClaimCenter administration UI
* Can be deployed immediately, without server downtime

(

| Business activity rule user interface G

* Navigate to Administration > Business Settings > Business Rules > Activity
Rules

* Can filter to show specific rules
* Can add, clone, export and import rules

¢ Filters for a specific jurisdiction return jurisdiction where the value is All in addition
to the jurisdiction

Activity Rules

Availability Any hd

Gi

+ The entity for which a rule executes

* Options include claim, exposure,
checkset, recoveryset, reserveset,

and recoveryreserveset ‘Trigger Action

fire

| Rule definition: Applies To

¢ Rules can apply to All types or to
Selected types

* Click the Selected radio button to see and
select values

* Selecting a value limits what the rule is
applied to

* Can apply any combination of:
* Loss type
* Policy type
+ Jurisdiction

| Rule Definition: Rule Condition

Criteria (one or more) which
determine when a rule applies

* None selected means the rule

actions are run for all candidates
meeting the trigger and Applies to
requirements
Criteria can be joined by AND,
OR, or some combination

Conditions have access to
data in the triggering entity

Use type-down to select
attributes

The following combination of criteria must evaluate to true (AND/OR)

| Student exercise G

Creating Activities with business activity
rules

| Migrating business activity rules Ga

* Create and test in a development environment, then migrate to the production
environment

¢ Business activity rules can be created in the production environment

¢ Useful for urgent situations like catastrophe management

A Gi
== =o=

Development Business Rule Production
Server Server

| Business activity rule life cycle G

On Development server:

« Draft — Business rule has been

created but may not yet be
complete or tested

« Staged — Business rule has
been tested and is ready for
deployment

On Production server:

« Approved — Business rule is
ready for deployment

* Deployed — rule is executing

Rule: CERO2000 - At least one activity for claim owner

Question

a What two types of objects can business activity rules create?
4
¢

en

Answer

a What two types of objects can business activity rules create?
4
¢

The correct answers are activities and history records

SS See See ease angen ses

Question

,— — What two restrictions are mandatory on a business activity rule?

¢
4
¢

en

Answer

,— — What two restrictions are mandatory on a business activity rule?

¢
4
¢

The correct answers are:
Trigger entity (restricts the business rule to respond to a specific entity)
Trigger action (restricts the business rule to respond to creation, or update action)

SS See See ease angen ses

Question

_— — What does setting the Rule Condition to None accomplish?

¢
4
¢

en

Answer

,— — What does setting the Rule Condition to None accomplish?
, ¢
¢
The correct answer is setting the Rule Condition to None means that all entities which
meet the Trigger Entity, the Trigger Action, and any Applies To values will be
processed by this rule.

SS See See ease angen ses
